title: AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner - Practice Exam (CLF-C01) - 2

domainGradeBreakdown.domainDescription: This represents exam questions for the Cloud Concepts section.

questions.questionText: Which AWS service can provide a Desktop as a Service (DaaS) solution?

choices.explanation:
Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed, secure Desktop-as-a-Service (DaaS) solution. You can use Amazon WorkSpaces to provision either Windows or Linux desktops in just a few minutes and quickly scale to provide thousands of desktops to workers across the globe.
https://aws.amazon.com/workspaces/?workspaces-blogs.sort-by=item.additionalFields.createdDate&workspaces-blogs.sort-order=desc

AWS Elastic Beanstalk is an easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications and services developed with Java, .NET, PHP, Node.js, Python, Ruby, Go, and Docker on familiar servers such as Apache, Nginx, Passenger, and IIS. https://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk/

Systems Manager can enable issuing commands to groups of instances, but this is not Desktop as a Service. AWS Systems Manager gives you visibility and control of your infrastructure on AWS. Systems Manager provides a unified user interface so you can view operational data from multiple AWS services and allows you to automate operational tasks across your AWS resources.
https://aws.amazon.com/systems-manager/

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) provides scalable computing capacity in the AWS Cloud. Using Amazon EC2 eliminates your need to invest in hardware up front, so you can develop and deploy applications faster.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/concepts.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon WorkSpaces is a managed, secure Desktop-as-a-Service (DaaS) solution. You can use Amazon WorkSpaces to provision either Windows or Linux desktops in just a few minutes and quickly scale to provide thousands of desktops to workers across the globe.
https://aws.amazon.com/workspaces/?workspaces-blogs.sort-by=item.additionalFields.createdDate&workspaces-blogs.sort-order=desc

questions.questionText: A company would like to add a support chatbot to the help page on their website. Which service will allow the users to build a conversational interface using voice and text?

choices.explanation: Translate provides language translation.
Lex helps you build conversational interfaces like chatbots.
Rekognition allows you to automate your image and video analysis.
Polly turns text into speech.

correctAnswers.explanation: Lex helps you build conversational interfaces like chatbots.

This is not a valid type.

questions.questionText: Your company is considering migrating its data center to the cloud. Which of the following is an advantage of the AWS Cloud over an on-premises data center?

choices.text: Maintain physical access to the new data center but share responsibility with AWS.
choices.explanation: The AWS Cloud does reside in AWS-owned data centers, but customers do not have physical access.

choices.text: Replace upfront operational expenses with low variable operational expenses.
choices.explanation: The focus on moving to the cloud is the ability to replace upfront capital expenses.

choices.text: Replace low variable costs with upfront capital expenses.
choices.explanation: This is incorrect and in no way factual.

choices.text: Replace upfront capital expenses with low variable costs.
choices.explanation:
All the hardware purchased upfront for a data center will be replaced by resources that are variable in nature with low upfront costs.
https://d1.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/introduction-to-aws-cloud-economics-final.pdf

correctAnswers.text: Replace upfront capital expenses with low variable costs.
correctAnswers.explanation:
All the hardware purchased upfront for a data center will be replaced by resources that are variable in nature with low upfront costs.
https://d1.awsstatic.com/whitepapers/introduction-to-aws-cloud-economics-final.pdf

questions.questionText: You want to use an AWS service that enables you to notify select Tech Support members in your company (via email) of any cloud-related issues to attend to. Which of the following services will accomplish that?

choices.explanation: SES is an email service that allows you to send richly formatted HTML emails from your applications. SES is ideal for marketing campaigns, not the scenario described.

With Simple Notification Service, or Amazon SNS, you can create and appropriately name a topic to which you publish your messages. Then, the select Tech Support members can subscribe to that topic to receive these messages as email notifications.
https://aws.amazon.com/sns/
Amazon SWF helps developers build, run, and scale background jobs that have parallel or sequential steps.
SQS is a message queuing service that allows you to build loosely coupled systems.

correctAnswers.explanation:
With Simple Notification Service, or Amazon SNS, you can create and appropriately name a topic to which you publish your messages. Then, the select Tech Support members can subscribe to that topic to receive these messages as email notifications.
https://aws.amazon.com/sns/

questions.questionText: Which of the following database migrations are classified as heterogeneous?

choices.text: Microsoft SQL Server to Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL
choices.explanation: In heterogeneous database migrations, the source and target databases tend to be different in schema structure, data type, and database code. SQL Server and PostgreSQL are not the same.
In heterogeneous database migrations, the source and target databases tend to be different in schema structure, data type, and database code. Oracle and Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL are not the same.

choices.text: Oracle to Amazon RDS for Oracle
choices.explanation: These are the same and are considered homogeneous.
These are the same and are considered homogeneous.

correctAnswers.text: Microsoft SQL Server to Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL
correctAnswers.explanation: In heterogeneous database migrations, the source and target databases tend to be different in schema structure, data type, and database code. SQL Server and PostgreSQL are not the same.
In heterogeneous database migrations, the source and target databases tend to be different in schema structure, data type, and database code. Oracle and Amazon Aurora PostgreSQL are not the same.

choices.explanation: There is a rule type in WAF called a "rate-based" rule that protects you from web-layer DDoS attacks, brute-force login attempts, and bots. (Note: This requires very detailed knowledge of WAF and will probably not be on the exam, but it's good to know just in case.)

questions.questionText: According to the AWS Shared Responsibility Model, which of the following is the customer responsible for?

choices.explanation:
AWS is responsible for protecting the infrastructure that runs its services. Such services include Amazon VPC, which enables a customer to provision a logically isolated section of the AWS Cloud. This section is simply referred to as a Virtual Private Cloud, or VPC. So, while AWS is responsible for the software (Amazon VPC), the customer is responsible for the virtual network created with that software (VPC), as well as whatever goes in it. This includes subnets (each of which consist of a range of IP addresses) and security groups (each of which acts as a virtual firewall to control inbound and outbound traffic).
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/vpc/latest/userguide/what-is-amazon-vpc.html

questions.questionText: Your company is migrating to the AWS Cloud. For servers, your company has existing per-core licenses they would like to continue to use. Which EC2 purchasing option allows this?  (Subject to your license terms).

choices.explanation:
Dedicated Hosts allow you to use your existing per-socket, per-core, or per-VM software licenses, subject to your license terms. 
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/dedicated-hosts/

Amazon EC2 Spot Instances let you take advantage of unused EC2 capacity in the AWS Cloud. Spot Instances are available at up to a 90% discount compared to On-Demand prices.
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/spot/

With On-Demand Instances, you pay for compute capacity by the second with no long-term commitments.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-on-demand-instances.html

Reserved Instances provide you with significant savings on your Amazon EC2 costs compared to On-Demand Instance pricing.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-reserved-instances.html

correctAnswers.explanation:
Dedicated Hosts allow you to use your existing per-socket, per-core, or per-VM software licenses, subject to your license terms. 
https://aws.amazon.com/ec2/dedicated-hosts/

questions.questionText: A huge department store sells products online and in-person. Most of their customers use credit cards instead of cash when making purchases. For security purposes, the credit card data must be encrypted at rest. Which services allow the department store to generate and store the encryption key used to secure the credit card numbers?

choices.explanation: CloudHSM is a hardware security module (HSM) used to generate and store encryption keys.
IAM allows you to control access to your AWS services and resources.
KMS allows you to generate and store encryption keys.
Secrets Manager allows you to manage and retrieve secrets (passwords or keys).

Macie uses machine learning to discover sensitive data stored on Amazon S3. Macie automatically detects a large and growing list of sensitive data types, including personally identifiable information (PII) such as names, addresses, and credit card numbers.

correctAnswers.explanation: CloudHSM is a hardware security module (HSM) used to generate and store encryption keys.
KMS allows you to generate and store encryption keys.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Secrets Manager allows you to manage and retrieve secrets (passwords or keys).

Macie uses machine learning to discover sensitive data stored on Amazon S3. Macie automatically detects a large and growing list of sensitive data types, including personally identifiable information (PII) such as names, addresses, and credit card numbers.

questions.questionText: When AWS uses tape media to perform backups in their data centers, who would be responsible for their safe and secure disposal?

choices.explanation: Since the media is held and controlled by AWS in their data center, the customer could not have any means, nor responsibility, to dispose of it securely.
Since this relates to physical media located within an AWS data center, it is the responsibility of AWS.

AWS retain responsibility for the safe and secure disposal of physical media and devices in their data centers. Even if outsourced to a third party, the responsibility belongs to AWS under the Shared Responsibility Model.
Since the media is held and controlled by AWS in their data center, the customer could not have any means, nor responsibility, to dispose of it securely.

correctAnswers.explanation: Since this relates to physical media located within an AWS data center, it is the responsibility of AWS.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Since the media is held and controlled by AWS in their data center, the customer could not have any means, nor responsibility, to dispose of it securely.

questions.questionText: A company is considering establishing a dedicated network connection from their on-premises data center to their AWS Cloud environment. They want a private connection that provides a more consistent network experience than the internet. Which cloud type gives access to the cloud from on-premises infrastructure?

choices.explanation: Multi-cloud is the use of multiple cloud computing providers in a single environment.
With the public cloud, all resources run in the cloud. Don't forget: This is the AWS Cloud.
With the hybrid cloud, some resources run in the cloud while others run on-premises. This means resources run in the AWS Cloud and your internal data center.
With the private cloud, all resources run on-premises. Don't forget: This is your internal data center.

correctAnswers.explanation: With the hybrid cloud, some resources run in the cloud while others run on-premises. This means resources run in the AWS Cloud and your internal data center.

questions.questionText: You have many database backups you need to store for an indefinite amount of time. If the backups are ever needed, they just need to be retrieved within 4 hours. What is the lowest-cost solution for this scenario?

choices.text: S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (formerly S3 Glacier)
choices.explanation: S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (formerly S3 Glacier) is the lowest cost S3 storage tier that also provides the needed recovery times. S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (formerly S3 Glacier) provides three retrieval options: Expedited retrievals (1â€“5 minutes), Standard retrievals (3â€“5 hours), and free bulk retrievals (typically in 5â€“12 hours). In the case of the question scenario, we would use S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval with a Standard retrieval. If recovery times of 12-48 hours were acceptable, S3 Glacier Deep Archive would be the best choice due to even lower cost.

EFS stands for Elastic File System. A file system is not suitable for storing backups.
Reference: [Amazon Elastic File System](https://aws.amazon.com/efs/)

S3-IA can be used to store backups and would provide a cost savings over S3, but it is still not the cheapest option available.
Reference: [Amazon S3 Storage Classes](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/)

The backups could certainly be stored in S3, but cost is a key requirement here and S3 is not the lowest-cost option.
Reference: [Amazon S3 Storage Classes](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/)

correctAnswers.text: S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (formerly S3 Glacier)
correctAnswers.explanation: S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (formerly S3 Glacier) is the lowest cost S3 storage tier that also provides the needed recovery times. S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval (formerly S3 Glacier) provides three retrieval options: Expedited retrievals (1â€“5 minutes), Standard retrievals (3â€“5 hours), and free bulk retrievals (typically in 5â€“12 hours). In the case of the question scenario, we would use S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval with a Standard retrieval. If recovery times of 12-48 hours were acceptable, S3 Glacier Deep Archive would be the best choice due to even lower cost.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation:
S3-IA can be used to store backups and would provide a cost savings over S3, but it is still not the cheapest option available.
Reference: [Amazon S3 Storage Classes](https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/)

questions.questionText: During disaster recovery exercises, you need to re-route traffic from EC2 instances to instances in another Region. With which service can you do this?

choices.explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a fast content delivery network (CDN) service that securely delivers data, videos, applications, and APIs to customers globally with low latency, high transfer speeds, all within a developer-friendly environment. CloudFront is integrated with AWS â€“ both physical locations that are directly connected to the AWS Global Infrastructure, as well as other AWS services.

Route 53 can be used for disaster recovery by simply shifting traffic to the new Region. Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable cloud Domain Name System (DNS) web service. It is designed to give developers and businesses an extremely reliable and cost-effective way to route end users to internet applications by translating names (like *www.example.com*) into the numeric IP addresses (like 192.0.2.1) that computers use to connect to each other. Amazon Route 53 is fully compliant with IPv6 as well.

AWS Auto Scaling monitors your applications and automatically adjusts the capacity to maintain steady, predictable performance at the lowest possible cost. Using AWS Auto Scaling, itâ€™s easy to set up application scaling for multiple resources across multiple services in minutes.
VPC peering facilitates communication between 2 different VPCs, but it is not a mechanism for disaster recovery. In a disaster situation, the original Region would be out of service.

correctAnswers.explanation: Route 53 can be used for disaster recovery by simply shifting traffic to the new Region. Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable cloud Domain Name System (DNS) web service. It is designed to give developers and businesses an extremely reliable and cost-effective way to route end users to internet applications by translating names (like *www.example.com*) into the numeric IP addresses (like 192.0.2.1) that computers use to connect to each other. Amazon Route 53 is fully compliant with IPv6 as well.

This is not an AWS service.

questions.questionText: When considering common cloud computing models, which model is Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (AWS EC2) an example of?

choices.explanation: PaaS involves developing software using web-based tools without worrying about the underlying infrastructure.
SaaS involves using a complete application, on-demand, that is offered to you through a vendor.

IaaS includes the fundamental building blocks that can be rented from AWS. AWS manages the infrastructure and provides you a virtual machine that you can use however you'd like to meet your business requirements.
FaaS is a serverless backend service that allows developers to write code without managing the underlying infrastructure.

correctAnswers.explanation: IaaS includes the fundamental building blocks that can be rented from AWS. AWS manages the infrastructure and provides you a virtual machine that you can use however you'd like to meet your business requirements.

questions.questionText: A company needs to use a load balancer that can serve traffic at the TCP and UDP layers. Additionally, it needs to handle millions of requests per second at very low latencies. Which load balancer should they use?

choices.explanation: This is not a valid option.

An Application Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of HTTP and HTTPS traffic and provides advanced request routing targeted at the delivery of modern application architectures, including microservices and containers. Operating at the individual request level (Layer 7), an Application Load Balancer routes traffic to targets within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) based on the content of the request.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

Classic Load Balancer provides basic load balancing across multiple Amazon EC2 instances and operates at both the request level and connection level. Classic Load Balancer is intended for applications that were built within the EC2-Classic network.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

Network Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and Transport Layer Security (TLS) traffic where extreme performance is required. Operating at the connection level (Layer 4), Network Load Balancer routes traffic to targets within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) and is capable of handling millions of requests per second while maintaining ultra-low latencies.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Network Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and Transport Layer Security (TLS) traffic where extreme performance is required. Operating at the connection level (Layer 4), Network Load Balancer routes traffic to targets within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) and is capable of handling millions of requests per second while maintaining ultra-low latencies.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

questions.questionText: Which of the following are pillars found in the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

choices.explanation: Security is a pillar in the Well-Architected Framework that provides best practices around data security.
Performance Efficiency (not optimization) is a pillar in the Well-Architected Framework.
The Operational Excellence pillar focuses on building applications that effectively support your workloads.
The Cost Optimization pillar focuses on building resilient systems at the least cost.
Operational Excellence is the pillar in the Well-Architected Framework that helps you design applications that support your workloads.

correctAnswers.explanation: The Operational Excellence pillar focuses on building applications that effectively support your workloads.
The Cost Optimization pillar focuses on building resilient systems at the least cost.

questions.questionText: A company is using CloudTrail to simplify operational analysis and troubleshooting. When tracking user activity, which content fields does CloudTrail track when a user accesses the AWS Management Console?

CloudTrail allows you to track the username.

choices.text: Previous state of the affected resource

questions.questionText: After experiencing unusual behavior in your AWS account, you need to determine if there are any issues with AWS that may be affecting your account. What section of the AWS Management Console helps you inspect account alerts and find remediation guidance for your account?

choices.explanation: CloudWatch will not alert you of any events with AWS that might impact your account.

Use the AWS Health Dashboard to learn about specific operational issues that affect your account. When you get an alert, it includes remediation details and specific guidance so that you can take action for events that affect your resources. 
Reference: [AWS Health Dashboard](https://aws.amazon.com/premiumsupport/technology/aws-health-dashboard/).

SNS allows you to send emails and text messages from your applications.
Reference: [Amazon SNS](https://aws.amazon.com/sns/?whats-new-cards.sort-by=item.additionalFields.postDateTime&whats-new-cards.sort-order=desc)
The AWS Knowledge Center gathers the most frequent questions and requests AWS received from customers.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Use the AWS Health Dashboard to learn about specific operational issues that affect your account. When you get an alert, it includes remediation details and specific guidance so that you can take action for events that affect your resources.

questions.questionText: Microsoft has announced a new patch for its operating system. For a platform-as-a-service solution, who would be responsible for applying the patch?

choices.explanation: The platform-as-a-service model removes the need for organizations to manage the underlying infrastructure (usually hardware and operating systems) and allows you to focus on the deployment and management of your applications.
The customer would be responsible for patching the operating system for infrastructure-as-a-service solutions.

choices.text: The customer for Spot instances only.
choices.explanation: The type of instance does not matter.
The customer is responsible for patching the operating system for infrastructure-as-a-service solutions, but AWS is responsible for patching the operating system for platform-as-a-service solutions.

correctAnswers.explanation: The platform-as-a-service model removes the need for organizations to manage the underlying infrastructure (usually hardware and operating systems) and allows you to focus on the deployment and management of your applications.

The No Upfront payment option does not provide the most savings. The No Upfront option does not require any upfront payment and provides a discounted hourly rate for the duration of the term.

Aurora is a relational database compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL that was created by AWS.

https://aws.amazon.com/rds/aurora/

questions.questionText: You are a Systems Administrator who has just started adding IAM users to your companyâ€™s AWS account. However, you worry that the users will not create passwords strong enough to prevent unauthorized access. What is the most reliable way to ensure that users are using strong passwords?

choices.text: Speak with each IAM user individually about the importance of creating strong passwords.
choices.explanation: This could as easily be an email instead but does nothing to programmatically enforce a strong password.

choices.text: Apply an IAM password policy to ensure users create appropriately strong passwords.
choices.explanation:
Use Identity and Access Management (IAM) to apply an IAM password policy. While awareness and training are critical to developing good security practices, the most reliable option is to use an IAM password policy, which won't allow users to use lower-strength passwords.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_passwords_account-policy.html?icmpid=docs_iam_Console

choices.text: Hold an AWS webinar to stress the importance of creating strong passwords.
choices.explanation: This could as easily be an email instead but does nothing to programmatically enforce a strong password.

choices.text: Ask for the password of each user and create a much stronger one by yourself.
choices.explanation: This is insecure and not a good option.

correctAnswers.text: Apply an IAM password policy to ensure users create appropriately strong passwords.
correctAnswers.explanation:
Use Identity and Access Management (IAM) to apply an IAM password policy. While awareness and training are critical to developing good security practices, the most reliable option is to use an IAM password policy, which won't allow users to use lower-strength passwords.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_passwords_account-policy.html?icmpid=docs_iam_Console

questions.questionText: A company can provision a new EC2 instance at the click of a button, which reduces the time to make those resources available to their development team from weeks to just minutes. Which benefit of cloud computing does this demonstrate?

choices.explanation: Going global in minutes means you can deploy applications in multiple Regions around the world.

choices.text: Stop spending money running and maintaining data centers.
choices.explanation: When you stop spending money on running and maintaining data centers, it means you can focus on projects that differentiate your business instead of managing data centers and servers.
The cloud gives you increased speed and agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.

choices.text: Trade capital expense for variable expense.
choices.explanation: Trading capital expense for variable expense means you no longer have to invest heavily in data centers and instead pay only when you use computing resources.

correctAnswers.explanation: The cloud gives you increased speed and agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Going global in minutes means you can deploy applications in multiple Regions around the world.

questions.questionText: Which is a core design principle for deploying resources in AWS?

choices.explanation: AWS can easily scale out and in to meet demands, so it is not necessary to plan capacity ahead of time.

choices.text: Estimate your S3 storage needs up front.
choices.explanation: S3 has a virtually endless supply of storage and no advantage can be gained from estimating your needs up front.
Deploying in multiple Availability Zones will protect against downtime should an Availability Zone be lost.

choices.text: Use a tight coupling of your resources and applications.
choices.explanation: It is a best practice to perform loose coupling. Loose coupling between services can also be done through asynchronous integration. It involves 1 component that generates events and another that consumes them. The 2 components do not integrate through direct point-to-point interaction but usually through an intermediate durable storage layer.

correctAnswers.explanation: Deploying in multiple Availability Zones will protect against downtime should an Availability Zone be lost.

questions.questionText: You have been tasked with creating identical, repeatable infrastructure for your customers. Which service will you use?

choices.explanation: CloudFormation provides the ability to provision a repeatedly deployable environment for your customers.
AWS Config is used to assess, audit, and evaluate the configurations of your AWS resources.
CloudWatch is a collection of services that help you monitor and observe your cloud resources.
CloudFront is a content delivery network used to cache content across the world.

correctAnswers.explanation: CloudFormation provides the ability to provision a repeatedly deployable environment for your customers.

questions.questionText: A developer deployed an application that consisted of 1 Lambda function, a DynamoDB table, and a firewall using Web Application Firewall (WAF) via the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI). When attempting to access the application's resources via the AWS Management Console, the developer cannot find the Lambda function or DynamoDB table. What could be the problem?

choices.text: The developer probably forgot to issue the "save" command when using the CLI.
choices.explanation: There is not a "save" option when issuing commands via the AWS CLI. For example, when you create a Lambda function with the `create-function` command, if you don't receive an error message, it was automatically created.

choices.text: The developer probably forgot to assign the appropriate IAM access permissions to themselves before closing the CLI.
choices.explanation: While you can provide granular access to Lambda functions via AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM), this is not the most plausible cause of the error.

choices.text: The default rules in WAF prevent everyone on the internet from accessing the application unless specifically granted.
choices.explanation: AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect your web applications or APIs against common web exploits. You must set up and configure rules to meet your business requirements.

choices.text: The developer is probably in a different Region from where the resources were initially deployed.
choices.explanation: Resources that aren't global are typically deployed to a specific Region. Since Regions are isolated and resources aren't automatically replicated across them, the developer needs to switch to the correct Region in order to find the resources.

correctAnswers.text: The developer is probably in a different Region from where the resources were initially deployed.
correctAnswers.explanation: Resources that aren't global are typically deployed to a specific Region. Since Regions are isolated and resources aren't automatically replicated across them, the developer needs to switch to the correct Region in order to find the resources.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.text: The default rules in WAF prevent everyone on the internet from accessing the application unless specifically granted.
incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: AWS WAF is a web application firewall that helps protect your web applications or APIs against common web exploits. You must set up and configure rules to meet your business requirements.

questions.questionText: A new web application is getting much more traffic than expected. You decide to add another EC2 instance to share the load. Which AWS concept best describes the act of changing the number of instances using the same instance size?

choices.explanation: Vertical scaling is increasing the size and computing power of a single instance or node without increasing the number of nodes or instances.
Elasticity is the ability to acquire resources as you need them and release resources when you no longer need them. Think of Auto Scaling and adding and removing instances as needed.
Horizontal scaling is the act of changing the number of nodes in a computing system without changing the size of any individual node. So, with horizontal scaling, we would add instances.
Durability refers to the level to which data can be protected. The high durability of S3 refers to its ability to retain data safely.

correctAnswers.explanation: Horizontal scaling is the act of changing the number of nodes in a computing system without changing the size of any individual node. So, with horizontal scaling, we would add instances.

questions.questionText: A company is considering moving their critical applications and databases to the cloud. They want to ensure their data never becomes corrupted or lost due to a system malfunction. A system that reliably stores data without loss is considered to be what?

choices.explanation: Although highly available systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time, durability is all about long-term data protection.
A system that stores data without loss is a durable one. Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.
While the cloud gives you increased agility through the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market, durability is all about long-term data protection.
While elasticity helps you match the supply of resources with changing workload demands, durability is all about long-term data protection.

correctAnswers.explanation: A system that stores data without loss is a durable one. Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation: Although highly available systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time, durability is all about long-term data protection.

questions.questionText: Deploying your EC2 instances across multiple AZs will help address which cloud concept?

choices.explanation: Having resources across multiple AZs is 1 way to design for high availability - the concept that your services in the cloud should be designed to tolerate failures in the underlying cloud infrastructure. AWS allows you to do this by providing Availability Zones - each 1 is independent from the others, and a failure in 1 should not impact the others. Therefore, if you deploy your application in 2 instances in 2 AZs, and 1 of the AZs fails, you will still have 1 instance running your application. Automation relates to simplifying common repeated tasks and removing the human element. Although scalability and elasticity (the ability to increase resources according to needs and the ability to go up and down in resources as needed) look like they might fit, as we are talking specifically about multiple AZs in the question, high availability is the more correct answer.
Using AWS services, you can automate manual tasks. This could be considered a correct answer if the question indicated a use of CloudFormation to deploy the EC2 instances.
Scalability provides consistent performance as a system handles growing workload requirements.
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand based on workload changes.

correctAnswers.explanation: Having resources across multiple AZs is 1 way to design for high availability - the concept that your services in the cloud should be designed to tolerate failures in the underlying cloud infrastructure. AWS allows you to do this by providing Availability Zones - each 1 is independent from the others, and a failure in 1 should not impact the others. Therefore, if you deploy your application in 2 instances in 2 AZs, and 1 of the AZs fails, you will still have 1 instance running your application. Automation relates to simplifying common repeated tasks and removing the human element. Although scalability and elasticity (the ability to increase resources according to needs and the ability to go up and down in resources as needed) look like they might fit, as we are talking specifically about multiple AZs in the question, high availability is the more correct answer.

questions.questionText: Your company has decided to use Amazon WorkSpaces. They can use Amazon WorkSpaces to provision either Windows or Linux desktops in just a few minutes. What type of solution is this?

choices.explanation: WorkSpaces does not provide an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) solution. An example of IaaS in AWS is EC2. EC2 users do not own the physical servers; AWS provides virtual servers. Users only pay for the usage of the servers, saving them the cost (and associated ongoing maintenance) of investing in physical hardware.

Amazon WorkSpaces provides a Desktop as a Service (DaaS) solution.
https://aws.amazon.com/workspaces/?workspaces-blogs.sort-by=item.additionalFields.createdDate&workspaces-blogs.sort-order=desc

A good example of Platform as a Service (PaaS) is AWS Elastic Beanstalk. A PaaS service removes the need for organizations to manage the underlying infrastructure (usually hardware and operating systems) and allows you to focus on the deployment and management of your applications.
SaaS is a licensing and delivery model whereby software is centrally managed and hosted by a provider and available to customers on a subscription basis.

correctAnswers.explanation:
Amazon WorkSpaces provides a Desktop as a Service (DaaS) solution.
https://aws.amazon.com/workspaces/?workspaces-blogs.sort-by=item.additionalFields.createdDate&workspaces-blogs.sort-order=desc

questions.questionText: Which type of Elastic Load Balancer is recommended for flexible application management and supports HTTP and HTTPS/2 traffic?

choices.text: None. The application needs to be upgraded.
choices.explanation:
There is a load balancer that works best for this.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

Network Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and Transport Layer Security (TLS) traffic where extreme performance is required. Operating at the connection level (Layer 4), Network Load Balancer routes traffic to targets within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) and is capable of handling millions of requests per second while maintaining ultra-low latencies.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

Classic Load Balancer provides basic load balancing across multiple Amazon EC2 instances and operates at both the request level and connection level. Classic Load Balancer is intended for applications that were built within the EC2-Classic network.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

Application Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of HTTP and HTTPS (HTTPS/2) traffic and provides advanced request routing targeted at the delivery of modern application architectures, including microservices and containers. Operating at the individual request level (Layer 7), Application Load Balancer routes traffic to targets within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) based on the content of the request.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/application-load-balancer/

correctAnswers.explanation:
Application Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of HTTP and HTTPS (HTTPS/2) traffic and provides advanced request routing targeted at the delivery of modern application architectures, including microservices and containers. Operating at the individual request level (Layer 7), Application Load Balancer routes traffic to targets within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) based on the content of the request.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/application-load-balancer/

incorrectSelectedAnswers.explanation:
Network Load Balancer is best suited for load balancing of Transmission Control Protocol (TCP), User Datagram Protocol (UDP), and Transport Layer Security (TLS) traffic where extreme performance is required. Operating at the connection level (Layer 4), Network Load Balancer routes traffic to targets within Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) and is capable of handling millions of requests per second while maintaining ultra-low latencies.
https://aws.amazon.com/elasticloadbalancing/

questions.questionText: You just had a Data Analyst join the company, and you have been tasked with creating a new IAM user accordingly. However, if there is a group in the account with the permission policy that will grant such access, you can add the user to that group instead.

questions.questionText: A company is rearchitecting its monolithic application using a microservices architecture. Which design principle for cloud architecture should the company consider?

choices.explanation: Loosely coupled components are preferred because they are connected but not dependent on each other.

questions.questionText: Which security concept confirms that users are who they say they are, by presenting an identity (username) and providing a verification (password)?

choices.explanation: The principle of least privilege involves giving a user the minimum access required to get the job done.
Authentication defines the "who" in regard to access. Authentication is where you present your identity (username) and provide verification (password).
Authorization defines the "what" in regard to access. Authorization determines which services and resources the authenticated identity has access to.
The root user is created when you first open your AWS account and has full access to your account.

correctAnswers.explanation: Authentication defines the "who" in regard to access. Authentication is where you present your identity (username) and provide verification (password).

questions.questionText: Which benefit of cloud computing is demonstrated when you don't have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you will need to run your applications?

choices.explanation: The cloud gives you increased agility. All the services you have access to help you innovate faster, giving you speed to market.
With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.
Durability is all about long-term data protection. This means your data will remain intact without corruption.
Highly available systems are designed to operate continuously without failure for a long time. These systems avoid loss of service by reducing or managing failures.

correctAnswers.explanation: With elasticity, you do not have to plan ahead of time how much capacity you need. You can provision only what you need, and then grow and shrink based on demand.

questions.questionText: Which statement below is one of the 6 advantages of cloud computing?

choices.text: Benefit from minor economies of scale.
choices.explanation:
By using cloud computing, you can achieve a lower variable cost than you can get on your own. Because usage from hundreds of thousands of customers is aggregated in the cloud, AWS can achieve higher economies of scale, which translates into lower pay-as-you-go prices.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

choices.text: Benefit from increased speed and agility.
choices.explanation:
In a cloud computing environment, new IT resources are only a click away, which means you reduce the time to make those resources available to your developers from weeks to just minutes. This results in a dramatic increase in agility for the organization since the cost and time it takes to experiment and develop is significantly lower.

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

There is little need to guess capacity.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html

choices.text: Trade variable expense for capital expense.
choices.explanation:
You trade capital expense for variable expense.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/aws-overview/six-advantages-of-cloud-computing.html
